The Managing Partner (MP) of a Tatum office will be responsible for building the local practice through market and business development, opportunity pursuit and engagement quality assurance. The MP is responsible for accomplishing strategic and budget objectives including building the local practice, achieving revenue and profitability goals and developing and managing a P&L. The MP is responsible for all local office hiring (leadership team – Client Service Partners/Recruiting Partners and mentoring and developing a team. The MP is also responsible for ensuring the overall quality of the Partner and Consultant pools. :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: Business development expert; leader by example; builder and leader of high performing team; Finance & Accounting background; manager of a P&L; communicator :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: RESPONSIBILITIES: :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: Business Development Responsibilities: :: 311 :: <BR/> :: 312 :: - The office MP spends 75% of time actively pursuing target clients, growing existing client accounts and networking/marketing Tatum services in the marketplace :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: Leads client pursuit activities, proposal generation and pipeline planning and strategy :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: - Oversees the creation and execution of a local market development strategy :: 317 :: <BR/> :: 318 :: - Transfers new and existing client relationships to the team (Client Service Partner) for further account development :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: - Actively manages client relations to insure that clients receive high quality service :: 321 :: <BR/> :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: GP/Revenue Responsibility: :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: - Manages and leads the development and achievement of: :: 326 :: <BR/> :: 327 :: • Revenue targets :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: • Profitability targets :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: • Utilization targets :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: - Oversees the pricing of all local office engagements :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: - Manages the office to an agreed, budgeted P&L :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: <BR/> :: 338 :: Freedom to Act/Accountability: :: 339 :: <BR/> :: 340 :: - Guidance given: Assignments are received in objective oriented terms. Provides guidance to subordinates based on organizational goals and company policy. Work is reviewed in terms of meeting the organization’s objectives and schedules :: 341 :: <BR/> :: 342 :: - Policy involvement: Follows operating policies. Follows organizational policies. :: 343 :: <BR/> :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: Supervisory/Relationship: :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: - The office MP spends 25% of time recruiting, developing and leading the local office team :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: - Accomplishes results through combined effort of team: :: 350 :: <BR/> :: 351 :: • Assists Client Service Partners (CSPs) by making introductions to target companies and existing clients, conducting joint client meetings, reviewing proposals, pricing and staffing, and identifying professional development opportunities :: 352 :: <BR/> :: 353 :: • Assists Recruiting Partners (RPs) by taking an active role in interviewing new partners / consultants, taking RPs on client scoping meetings, participating in consultant retention activities, and identifying professional development opportunities :: 354 :: <BR/> :: 355 :: - Oversees the work of designated professionals on marketing efforts :: 356 :: <BR/> :: 357 :: - Manages effective local office orientation & integration process for new Tatum professionals :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: - Provides coaching and performs periodic performance reviews as appropriate :: 360 :: <BR/> :: 361 :: Direct Work Involvement/Complexity: :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: o Leads business development activities and assists other team members in target / client pursuit activities :: 364 :: <BR/> :: 365 :: o Responsible for all projects assigned to team. Acts as an advisor to subordinate staff members to help meet established schedules or resolved technical or operational problems. :: 366 :: <BR/> :: 367 :: o Develops and leads local market communication strategy with team, consultants, partners, clients and target companies :: 368 :: <BR/> :: 369 :: o Leads the process for expanding the market’s awareness of Tatum as the premier source of executive and consulting services :: 370 :: <BR/> :: 371 :: o Oversees the creation and execution of a local market strategy :: 372 :: <BR/> :: 373 :: o Expands and maintain key referral source relationships :: 374 :: <BR/> :: 375 :: o Works effectively within the market and on an organization-wide basis to promote the successful expansion of market segment and service offering initiative :: 376 :: <BR/> :: 377 :: o Leads team opportunity pursuits, including client diagnostic sessions, and private equity post-purchase agenda and resources assessments, resulting in: :: 378 :: <BR/> :: 379 :: • A high level of likelihood that engagements will be successful in achieving client’s objectives :: 380 :: <BR/> :: 381 :: • Opportunities that utilize multiple Tatum professionals :: 382 :: <BR/> :: 383 :: • Conversion of position filling opportunities into solution provide engagements :: 384 :: <BR/> :: 385 :: o Leads local team to source and close new engagements at pricing levels that reflect the premium value delivered by our organization and produces attractive compensation and promotes growth in the market :: 386 :: <BR/> :: 387 :: Impact: :: 388 :: <BR/> :: 389 :: • Erroneous decisions or recommendations would possibly result in delays and modifications to project/operations; possibly cause expenditure of time, human resources, and funds :: 390 :: <BR/> :: 391 :: Liaison: :: 392 :: <BR/> :: 393 :: • Frequent contacts with equivalent level inter-organizational managers and customer representatives concerning projects, operational decisions, scheduling requirements or contractual clarification. Conducts briefings and technical meetings for internal and external representatives :: 394 :: <BR/> :: 395 :: • Active and visible in appropriate business community organizations, especially on the Board or committee level :: 396 :: <BR/> :: 397 :: • Coordinates with corporate marketing on efforts specific to the local market :: 398 :: <BR/> :: 399 :: <BR/> :: 400 :: EDUCATION: :: 401 :: <BR/> :: 402 :: Bachelor’s degree in related field required :: 403 :: <BR/> :: 404 :: Advanced degree in related field preferred :: 405 :: <BR/> :: 406 :: <BR/> :: 407 :: EXPERIENCE: :: 408 :: <BR/> :: 409 :: 15+ years experience working and selling professional/consulting services preferred :: 410 :: <BR/> :: 411 :: Demonstrated experience leading a team in a professional/ consulting services setting preferred :: 412 :: <BR/> :: 413 :: Financial/accounting background preferred :: 414 :: <BR/> :: 415 :: <BR/> :: 416 :: SKILLS REQUIRED: :: 417 :: <BR/> :: 418 :: • Ability to develop relationships and to sell Tatum’s four services – CFO, Project, Advisory, Retained – to target companies and clients in the local market place :: 419 :: <BR/> :: 420 :: • Ability to understand the needs of the prospective client and to recommend the appropriate solution using the organization’s business model :: 421 :: <BR/> :: 422 :: • Ability to qualify and close deals utilizing appropriate pricing strategy and negotiation :: 423 :: <BR/> :: 424 :: • Ability to recruit, develop and lead a local office team :: 425 :: <BR/> :: 426 :: • Experience and expertise in accounting and controllership issues :: 427 :: <BR/> :: 428 :: • Experience in developing and managing sales and marketing programs :: 429 :: <BR/> :: 430 :: • Strong interpersonal and communication skills :: 431 :: <BR/> :: 432 :: • Proven ability to work within a team environment :: 433 :: <BR/> :: 434 :: • Ability to make decisions, take direction and execute a plan :: 435 :: <BR/> :: 436 :: • Detail orientation with follow-through shown in previous jobs :: 437 :: <BR/> :: 438 :: • Able to communicate with and present at the executive level :: 439 :: <BR/> :: 440 :: • Ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously :: 441 :: <BR/> :: 442 :: <BR/> :: 443 :: EOE :: 444 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 445 :: <BR/> :: 446 :: <BR/> :: 447 :: <BR/> :: 448 :: 	Apply to Job :: 449 :: The Client Service Director reports directly to the Regional Managing Director. :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: Responsibilities: :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: •Continually develops new business by identifying target clients, networking, meeting with target clients, and selling all Resources' service lines. :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: •Cultivates and expands existing business relationships through frequent communication and regular client visits. :: 314 :: <BR/> :: 315 :: •Produces revenue by generating project opportunities, clarifying the scope of projects with clients, matching consultants' skill sets with client engagement needs, presenting qualified consultants to the client and negotiating bill and pay rates. :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: •Identifies future project needs of client and minimizes engagement disruption through managing engagement and ensuring clients' expectations are met. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: •Minimizes consultant unassigned time by managing consultant roll off dates and communicating regularly with consultants regarding additional client needs and/or other appropriate engagements in the pipelines. :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: •Ensures approved business contracts are executed by taking responsibility for the completion of all engagement paperwork, including the timely receipt of signed engagement letters. :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: •Supports team goals of office by participating in strategy meetings, including discussing candidate and consultant pipeline, marketing strategies, and current challenges. :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: •Provides for timely collection of receivables by monitoring payment of client invoices. :: 326 :: <BR/> :: 327 :: Professional Qualifications: :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: <BR/> :: 330 :: We recruit for talent, integrity, enthusiasm and loyalty. The position requires business maturity, excellent judgment and a hands-on entrepreneurial spirit. Successful candidates generally have10-15 years of professional services and industry experience. :: 331 :: <BR/> :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: •Big Four public accounting, consulting, and/or audit experience at the manager level or higher. :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: •Experience selling professional services, networking and generating leads. :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: Demonstrated track record of positive change in all positions held. :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: •Strong professional network in the proximity of the local office. :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: •Bachelor's degree from a four year accredited institution is required, CPA is a plus. :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: •Experience identifying opportunities with clients, networking and generating leads. :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: •A high level of enthusiasm for building the business and the capacity to overcome obstacles. :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: Personal Characteristics: :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: <BR/> :: 350 :: •A high level of enthusiasm for building a business and a personal sense of urgency and capacity to overcome obstacles. :: 351 :: <BR/> :: 352 :: •An entrepreneurial individual who thrives on building and growing a successful and dynamic practice. :: 353 :: <BR/> :: 354 :: •Ability to respond effectively and quickly to clients' needs and issues. :: 355 :: <BR/> :: 356 :: •Ability to negotiate and communicate complex concepts/business issues verbally and in writing to clients, consultants and management. :: 357 :: <BR/> :: 358 :: •Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities/projects and proven ability to develop business relationships. :: 359 :: <BR/> :: 360 :: Resources Global Professionals is an equal opportunity employer. :: 361 :: <BR/> :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: Resources Global Professionals offers an attractive compensation and benefits package that includes: competitive base salary, medical/dental, bonus incentive plan, 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, and stock options. The long-term success of this individual will only be limited by his/her performance. CA :: 264 :: 	<B> Company: </B> :: 265 :: 	Cube Management :: 266 :: 	<B> Job Code: </B> :: 267 :: 	344748 :: 268 :: 	<B> Location(s): </B> :: 269 :: 	California - SAN FRANCISCO :: 270 :: 	<B> Industries: </B> :: 271 :: 	<BR/> :: 272 :: 	1-5	<B> Functions: </B> :: 275 :: 	<BR/> :: 276 :: 	2-5	<B> Job Type: </B> :: 281 :: 	Fulltime :: 282 :: 	<B> Compensation: </B> :: 283 :: 	<BR/> :: 284 :: 	Base Salary: $100,000.00 OTE: $200,000.00 :: 285 :: 	<B> Description </B> :: 286 :: 	<BR/> :: 287 :: Account Executive - Learning Centers - N. CA :: 288 :: <BR/> :: 289 :: <BR/> :: 290 :: Our client is the largest private early childhood education (ECE) provider in the US, and plays a critical role in preparing our youngest children for school and a lifelong love of learning. They are passionate about their ability to positively impact the lives of children and families every day and, in turn, contribute to the vitality of the local communities they serve. :: 291 :: <BR/> :: 292 :: <BR/> :: 293 :: They offer early childhood education and care through approximately 1,700 community-based centers and employer partnerships; and primary and middle school supplemental educational solutions including before- and after-school academic enrichment programs and summer camps through more than 400 sites nationwide. They provide a network of more than 3,700 locations worldwide, employing over 40,000 education professionals, and reaching over 300,000 students daily. :: 294 :: <BR/> :: 295 :: <BR/> :: 296 :: They are in search of 5 Account Executives to call on large Corporate HR Departments and Healthcare facilities to promote the development of Employer Partnership Learning Centers at the employer facility. YOU MUST have experience calling on Large Corporate HR Department selling some type of service. :: 297 :: <BR/> :: 298 :: <BR/> :: 299 :: Locations: New York or Boston, Atlanta or anywhere in FL, Texas, Chicago, Northern CA (Bay Area) :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: Relocation: NO :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: Base Salary: $100,000.00 :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: OTE: $200,000.00 :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: Key Responsibilities :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: * Achieve pre-defined target sales goals with corporations willing to subsidize learning programs with a special emphasis on large clients by improving overall visibility and perception of Corporate Solutions business. :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: * Generate new business by prospecting new accounts (lead generation, cold calling, and networking); proactively identifying potential sales opportunities. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: * Negotiate strategic agreements with key business executives of potential customers (i.e., CFO, VP of HR/Benefits, VP of Admin. etc) with assistance from the Legal Department. :: 321 :: <BR/> :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: * Use Company data and past experience to develop effective strategies and business/action plans for strategic accounts. :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: <BR/> :: 326 :: * Develop and implement internal marketing campaigns with corporate customers to effectively market the benefits of the their solutions to their clients’ employees. Must have the ability to demonstrate creativity and resourcefulness in finding ways to promote their products and services to accounts. :: 327 :: <BR/> :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: * Prepare and deliver sales presentations to customers in a professional and effective manner. :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: <BR/> :: 332 :: Key Skills :: 333 :: <BR/> :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: * BA/BS Degree or equivalent. 7 + years experience in B2B sales, focused on the Corporate HR environment. :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: * Strong face-to-face consultative selling skills, with an emphasis on the ability to influence decisions and connect the client's solutions to customer needs. :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: * Ability to make strategic decisions on the appropriate programs and business deals for each customer. :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: * Ability to manage schedule and to assess customer needs on an independent basis. :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: * Experience in outbound prospecting and direct sales - both via phone and in person. :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: * Consistent record of exceeding sales targets. :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: * Strong track record of business development with new clients – proven experience developing partnerships with clients. Must have the ability to communicate with and build relationships at all levels of a corporate client's organization. :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: * Ability to develop relationships and work well with clients, partners and internal team members. :: 350 :: <BR/> :: 351 :: * Experience with understanding the post-sale implications of implementing a large-scale offering at a national corporation. :: 352 :: <BR/> :: 353 :: * High-energy, strong work ethic, a passion for sales and a focus on results are essential. :: 354 :: <BR/> :: 355 :: * Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to effectively articulate information to clients. Good listener; prevents misunderstandings and resolves problems. :: 356 :: <BR/> :: 357 :: * Organized, proactive, and plans for the future. Responsive to unanticipated circumstances and can quickly shift priorities. :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: * Well-developed analytic abilities. :: 360 :: <BR/> :: 361 :: * Understands the effect of the obesity crisis on the workplace and its associated impact on healthcare costs. :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: * Understand trends and best practices in B2B selling. :: 364 :: <BR/> :: 365 :: * Experience with Sales Force Automation preferred. :: 366 :: <BR/> :: 367 :: * Operates effectively in a wide diversity of highly complex and ambiguous work situations. :: 368 :: <BR/> :: 369 :: * Extensive travel required. :: 370 :: <BR/> :: 371 :: <BR/> :: 372 :: If you wish to be part of this successful and vibrant organization, please email a MS Word version of your resume to recruiting511@cubemanagement.com. This company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. :: 373 :: <BR/> :: 374 :: <BR/> :: 375 :: Cube Management helps companies accelerate their sales, by providing the Sales & Marketing talent they need to grow their business. Cube Management is a leading recruiting and consulting partner to emerging growth, mid-market and global companies in the technology, manufacturing, healthcare and business service sectors. We work across the spectrum of Sales, Marketing and Business Development, providing holistic solutions that drive revenue and profit success. Cube Management combines Strategy, Process and People, to produce great results. This is a unique opportunity to leverage your existing technical skills, tap into your creativity, and satisfy that entrepreneurial drive. This position will be located in Dallas. :: 302 :: <BR/> :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: Responsibilities: :: 305 :: <BR/> :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: •Continually develop new business by identifying target clients, networking, meeting with target clients, and selling all Resources’ service lines. :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: •Cultivate and expand existing business relationships through frequent communication and regular client visits. :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: •Sell projects to new and existing clients, clarifying the scope of projects with clients, identifying business solutions, presenting qualified Consultants to the client, and negotiating billing arrangements. :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: •Represent Resources in appropriate professional and community organizations. :: 314 :: <BR/> :: 315 :: •Identify future project needs of clients and ensuring clients’ expectations are met. :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: •Minimize Consultants “unassigned time” by managing Consultant roll off dates and communicating regularly with Consultants regarding additional client needs and/or other appropriate engagements in the pipelines. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: •Assist in the recruitment of Consultant, conduct interviews and assess skill set and competencies of candidates, negotiate Consultants’ compensation. :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: •Ensure approved business contracts are executed by taking responsibility for the completion of all engagement paperwork, including the timely receipt of signed engagement letters. :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: •Support team goals of office by participating in strategy meetings, including discussing candidate and Consultant pipeline, marketing strategies, and current challenges. :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: •Provide for timely collection of receivables by monitoring payment of client invoices. :: 326 :: <BR/> :: 327 :: •Maintain strong communications with Consultants assigned to client engagements. :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: <BR/> :: 330 :: Professional Qualifications: :: 331 :: <BR/> :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: •Minimum Requirements: Ten (10) years of experience, including Big Four public accounting/ auditing experience and management level experience in the Accounting/Finance industry; and a professional network in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: •4-year bachelor degree required. :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: •Previous experience performing business development/sales of professional services strongly preferred. :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: •CPA strongly preferred. :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: •Experience identifying opportunities with clients, networking and generating leads. :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: •Demonstrated track record of positive change in all positions held. :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: <BR/> :: 346 :: Personal Characteristics: :: 347 :: <BR/> :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: •A high level of enthusiasm for building a business and a personal sense of urgency and capacity to overcome obstacles. :: 350 :: <BR/> :: 351 :: •Ability to respond effectively and quickly to clients’ needs and issues. :: 352 :: <BR/> :: 353 :: •Ability to negotiate and communicate complex concepts/business issues verbally and in writing to clients, Consultants and management. :: 354 :: <BR/> :: 355 :: •Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities/projects and proven ability to develop business relationships. :: 356 :: <BR/> :: 357 :: Reporting: The Director of Client Service - Accounting/Finance reports to the Office Managing Director located in Dallas. :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: <BR/> :: 360 :: Resources Global Professionals offers an attractive compensation and benefits package that includes: competitive base salary, medical/dental, bonus incentive plan, 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, and stock options. The long-term success of this individual will only be limited by his/her performance. For this position, we do not offer relocation assistance. :: 361 :: <BR/> :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. :: 364 :: <BR/> :: 365 :: In order to view the contact details for this job, you must be a member of 6FigureJobs. Reporting directly to the SVP, Corporate Controller, the Vice President, Assistant Corporate Controller leads the corporate accounting and SEC reporting processes. As a member of the senior Corporate Finance Team, the position has high visibility to the CFO, CEO and key members of the senior management team and the Audit Committee. The Vice President, Assistant Corporate Controller is responsible for preparation and reporting of financial statements in accordance with GAAP and SEC requirements. This includes supporting analyses and reports for senior management and Board of Directors. This person leads the global financial reporting, consolidation and management reporting process, related financial policies and procedures and is responsible for the day-to-day operation, leadership and management of the corporate accounting function. Additionally, the Vice President, Assistant Corporate Controller oversees the monthly, quarterly and annual financial closing processes. :: 292 :: <BR/> :: 293 :: <BR/> :: 294 :: Requirements: :: 295 :: <BR/> :: 296 :: •10 to 15 years of finance and/or accounting experience with increasing responsibility. :: 297 :: <BR/> :: 298 :: •CPA or advanced degree with Big 4 public accounting required. :: 299 :: <BR/> :: 300 :: •Extensive experience in SEC reporting at a public company. :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: •Experience in compliance with disclosure controls including internal control over financial reporting. :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: 	Apply to Job :: 310 :: At :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: the heart of every Bose automotive sound :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: system is the amplifier, which contains the :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: proprietary power and signal processing :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: technologies that deliver long lasting :: 314 :: <BR/> :: 315 :: satisfaction to our customers. :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: Bose Automotive is searching for a candidate :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: to provide the leadership to advance our :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: electronics to new levels of energy efficiency, :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: reduced size and mass, and signal :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: processing capability. The ideal candidate will bring :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: a knowledge of the industry, will already :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: know many of the customer decision makers :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: and key technology suppliers and contacts, :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: and have a track record of success in :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: launching sophisticated electronics on :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: demanding schedules, within budget, and :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: with high quality. :: 350 :: <BR/> :: 351 :: <BR/> :: 352 :: <BR/> :: 353 :: The person selected for this challenging role :: 354 :: <BR/> :: 355 :: will lead a capable and seasoned :: 356 :: <BR/> :: 357 :: management team that oversees the :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: development of hardware, embedded :: 360 :: <BR/> :: 361 :: software, and mechanical design. The :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: candidate selected will report to the director :: 364 :: <BR/> :: 365 :: of Research and Development for Bose :: 366 :: <BR/> :: 367 :: Automotive, and will be part of a technical :: 368 :: <BR/> :: 369 :: leadership team that is focused on innovation :: 370 :: <BR/> :: 371 :: and excellence in everything we do. This role works closely with a multitude of functions across the company and around the global product development team. The Company's design centers are located in: Europe, South Africa, Asia Pacific, and the Americas. :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: A position in product development holds significant amount of responsibility in the global organization surrounding the assessment, prioritization, and execution to market on new products to meet the user requirements. Ongoing job responsibilities include: product lifecycle management, end-user research, market share analysis, financial cost/pricing/margin assessments, market gap and need requirements, innovation development, program prioritization, commercialization to market, training, and brand building activities that support the company's overall strategy and goals. :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: This role works closely with global engineering and local sales and marketing teams to ensure revenue, consumer, and customer satisfaction goals are met; ultimately delivering results that support the vision and strategy surround product categories. :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: Location: Vista, CA :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: Relocation: YES :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: Travel: 30% :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: <BR/> :: 324 :: Base Salary: $180,000.00 - $250,000.00 :: 325 :: <BR/> :: 326 :: Benefits: Typical Large Company Benefits :: 327 :: <BR/> :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: CATEGORY: AUTOMATION :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: <BR/> :: 334 :: • The Director will aid in the global leadership and category strategy of Automation. The global development of this category is lead out of Vista, CA. :: 335 :: <BR/> :: 336 :: • This individual is the key liaison between Engineering and Marketing/Sales with a leadership role in the development of product road strategies for growth and profitability. Oversee coordination of all product development responsibilities. :: 337 :: <BR/> :: 338 :: • Automation is found in most of the functions of the pool management. This role needs to have a vision and coordinate with other functions and categories in the company. For example, Automation controls Heaters, Pumps, Salt Water Chlorinators, etc. :: 339 :: <BR/> :: 340 :: • Define and manage the product roadmap strategy 3-5 year forward looking. :: 341 :: <BR/> :: 342 :: • Establish key consumer insights utilizing various qualitative and quantitative research methods. Provide guidance and direction to Engineering on solutions to meet consumer needs. :: 343 :: <BR/> :: 344 :: • Commercialization of New Product Launches. Lead the development of core positioning and comprehensive marketing launch plans to consumers and customers. :: 345 :: <BR/> :: 346 :: • Analysis of sales data, market share, pricing, costs, and profit for regular reporting and to identify trends and tactics. Set pricing and manage costs to meet revenue and profitability goals. :: 347 :: <BR/> :: 348 :: • Be a complete expert in the market relative to the competition, category trends, and share position. Create business plans and product development documents as required per processes in place. :: 349 :: <BR/> :: 350 :: • Strong presentation skills required. In creation of power point content and delivery of presentation. :: 351 :: <BR/> :: 352 :: • Assist Brand & Communications team with development of literature, collateral materials, technical writing, copy editing, and internet to support marketing of respective products. :: 353 :: <BR/> :: 354 :: <BR/> :: 355 :: <BR/> :: 356 :: OTHER FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES :: 357 :: <BR/> :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: • Cross functional support with Brand & Communications, Channel Marketing, Sales, Finance, and Operations. :: 360 :: <BR/> :: 361 :: • Brief and train Sales, Customer Service, and Service personnel within the organization. :: 362 :: <BR/> :: 363 :: • Plan and coordinate inventory requirements. :: 364 :: <BR/> :: 365 :: • Participate in respective and related Tradeshows, Customer Events, Sales Meetings. :: 366 :: <BR/> :: 367 :: • Establish and maintain work processes, facilitate and initiate communication between all groups, and manage expectations of all parties. :: 368 :: <BR/> :: 369 :: <BR/> :: 370 :: QUALIFICATIONS :: 371 :: <BR/> :: 372 :: <BR/> :: 373 :: • 8+ years of work experience in a marketing field. :: 374 :: <BR/> :: 375 :: • Product development experience required. :: 376 :: <BR/> :: 377 :: • Prefer candidate to have some experience in automation functions or electronics :: 378 :: <BR/> :: 379 :: • Strong strategic thinking and problem solving skills :: 380 :: <BR/> :: 381 :: • Exceptional communication and organizational skills. :: 382 :: <BR/> :: 383 :: • Proficient in MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word. :: 384 :: <BR/> :: 385 :: <BR/> :: 386 :: REQUIRED :: 387 :: <BR/> :: 388 :: <BR/> :: 389 :: • Bachelor’s Degree required :: 390 :: <BR/> :: 391 :: <BR/> :: 392 :: PREFERRED :: 393 :: <BR/> :: 394 :: <BR/> :: 395 :: • Successful experience in product development, sales channel management, building brand awareness, national marketing campaigns, or tactical development. :: 396 :: <BR/> :: 397 :: <BR/> :: 398 :: If you wish to be part of this successful and vibrant organization, please email a MS Word version of your resume to recruiting515@cubemanagement.com. This company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. :: 399 :: <BR/> :: 400 :: <BR/> :: 401 :: Cube Management helps companies accelerate their sales, by providing the Sales & Marketing talent they need to grow their business. Cube Management is a leading recruiting and consulting partner to emerging growth, mid-market and global companies in the technology, manufacturing, healthcare and business service sectors. We work across the spectrum of Sales, Marketing and Business Development, providing holistic solutions that drive revenue and profit success. Cube Management combines Strategy, Process and People, to produce great results. For a complete list of our job openings, please visit www.cubemanagement.com :: 402 :: <BR/> :: 403 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 404 :: <BR/> :: 405 :: <BR/> :: 406 :: <BR/> :: 407 :: 	Apply to Job :: Cube Management is a leading recruiting and consulting partner to emerging growth, mid-market and global companies in the technology, manufacturing, healthcare and business service sectors. We work across the spectrum of Sales, Marketing and Business Development, providing holistic solutions that drive revenue and profit success. Cube Management combines Strategy, Process and People, to produce great results. The business is growing through a combination of organic growth as well as through acquisitions and we're seeking an experienced finance and accounting executive. You will join the ranks as Corporate Controller with the plan to be the ultimate successor to the CFO. The qualified candidate will have experience in the for-profit education sector and have excelled in a fast-paced, high growth business. You will have an orientation towards the operations of the business and will play a pivotal role in special projects related to both financial and non-financial initiatives. :: 288 :: <B> Apply Here They are currently seeking an Account Executive to represent their line of passive shock and vibration isolation systems to Aerospace and Industrial Industries in California. The successful candidate will currently be calling on at least one of these two accounts selling some type of industrial product or service. :: 295 :: <BR/> :: 296 :: <BR/> :: 297 :: Location: Los Angeles, CA :: 298 :: <BR/> :: 299 :: <BR/> :: 300 :: Relocation: No :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: <BR/> :: 303 :: Base Salary: $100,000.00 :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: <BR/> :: 306 :: OTE: $120,000.00 :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: Travel: > 50% :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: <BR/> :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: Job Duties: :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: * Manage our client's existing business and grow new opportunities within the Aerospace and Industrial Industry Accounts. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: <BR/> :: 322 :: Job Requirements: :: 323 :: <BR/> :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: * Established relationship the Aerospace and Industrial Industries :: 326 :: <BR/> :: 327 :: * Technical 4 year degree :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: * At least 5 years of selling experience selling industrial products. :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: * Stable work history :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: <BR/> :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: <BR/> :: 336 :: If you wish to be part of this successful and vibrant organization, please email a MS Word version of your resume to recruiting470@cubemanagement.com. This company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. :: 337 :: <BR/> :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: Cube Management helps companies accelerate their sales, by providing the Sales & Marketing talent they need to grow their business. Cube Management is a leading recruiting and consulting partner to emerging growth, mid-market and global companies in the technology, manufacturing, healthcare and business service sectors. We work across the spectrum of Sales, Marketing and Business Development, providing holistic solutions that drive revenue and profit success. Cube Management combines Strategy, Process and People, to produce great results. I could call the client wearing my bathrobe and avoid traffic... :: 247 :: 	Read Full Article :: 248 :: 	/ExecNewsLetter.cfm?100k=1&jrl=1&l=2486#three :: 249 :: 	Job Description :: 250 :: 	« :: 251 :: 	Back :: 252 :: 	ExecSearchJobsList.cfm?100k=1&tm=10&am=&intPageNo=0&sort=date_submitted&sortorder=desc :: 253 :: 	Bookmark :: 254 :: 	# :: 255 :: 	Print :: 256 :: 	javascript:window.print(); :: 257 :: 	Share :: 258 :: 	| :: 259 :: 	Apply to Job :: 260 :: 	ExecOneClickApply.cfm?100k=1&tm=10&am=&intPageno=0&intJobID=1047272&blnVisit=1&sort=date_submitted&sortorder=desc :: 261 :: 	<BR/> :: 262 :: 	 	<B> Title: </B> :: 263 :: 	User Experience Architect :: 264 :: 	<B> Company: </B> :: 265 :: 	Model Metrics :: 266 :: 	<B> Job Code: </B> :: 267 :: 	MM-UX :: 268 :: 	<B> Location(s): </B> :: 269 :: 	Illinois - CHICAGO :: 270 :: 	<B> Industries: </B> :: 271 :: 	<BR/> :: 272 :: 	1-18	<B> Functions: </B> :: 275 :: 	<BR/> :: 276 :: 	2-18	<B> Job Type: </B> :: 283 :: 	Fulltime :: 284 :: 	<B> Compensation: </B> :: 285 :: 	<BR/> :: 286 :: 	 	<B> Description </B> :: 287 :: 	<BR/> :: 288 :: We are noted as one of the fastest growing companies in Chicago with 80 percent year over year revenue growth and 75 percent employee growth. We are Model Metrics and have just been ranked the #1 Top Workplace for Employees in our Category by the Chicago Tribune; we have also been named as a finalist in the 2010 Chicago Innovation Awards for its 2GO Mobile Cloud Platform. We were also named a Gartner 2011 Cool Vendor in Application Services and a leader in the Forrester Wave for Salesforce.com SI’s for companies under $100M. :: 289 :: <BR/> :: 290 :: <BR/> :: 291 :: Model Metrics is an industry pioneering consulting firm, helping enterprise organizations accelerate the adoption of Cloud Computing. Model Metrics has forged relationships with the nation’s leading Cloud Computing companies, including salesforce.com, Amazon, Apple, and Google. No more servers. No more software. No more upgrade headaches. Just tremendous ROI! Headquartered in Chicago, the Model Metrics team is highly respected in taking bleeding edge technologies and helping businesses understand how to leverage them successfully, from custom mobile solutions for iPad and Android built in the Cloud, to strategic business process work to change management and adoption. :: 292 :: <BR/> :: 293 :: <BR/> :: 294 :: As our User Experience Architect, you will be responsible for the review of all creative elements associated with our most important client deliverables across all types of projects, including customer and partner portals, social applications for business, mobile applications on iPads, Android tablets, smartphones and enterprise business applications across nearly every department function. You will work closely with our Delivery team, assign internal and external resources for projects, and use a sharp eye to ensure adherence to quality guidelines. You must have relevant experience creating and managing design direction for clients within various verticals. Your strong understanding of UX and UI will add to brainstorm new concepts and develop design mocks for clients. You will have the leadership ability to oversee and coach a creative team of Producers, Designers, and Developers. :: 295 :: <BR/> :: 296 :: <BR/> :: 297 :: In order to qualify you must have the following essential skills: :: 298 :: <BR/> :: 299 :: <BR/> :: 300 :: • Bachelor’s degree required from an accredited 4 year university or college or equivalent experience :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: <BR/> :: 303 :: • At least 5 years in professional services or agency experience :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: <BR/> :: 306 :: • A strong background in HCI or interactive design :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: • Experience with prototyping and wireframing tools (Balsamiq, OmniGraffle, Visio) and techniques :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: <BR/> :: 312 :: • Experience interacting with technical teams :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: <BR/> :: 315 :: • Strong attention to detail and passion for creative thinking :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: <BR/> :: 318 :: • Experience managing a creative team :: 319 :: As President and COO for the business, your focus will be opening new markets on an international basis as well as expanding penetration into existing markets while overseeing production in multi-facility, multi-location model. Business currently operates from a North American base and is poised for growth on an international scale. You will transition into the CEO's shoes beginning by taking charge of sales and operations and driving the enterprise to the next level. :: 294 :: <BR/> :: 295 :: <BR/> :: 296 :: We are looking for an accomplished business builder with well-rounded general management skills in the agricultural products sector. This opportunity requires a fact-based decision-maker who identifies key metrics and establishes a focused, targeted strategic plan and then executes on that. Should have international experience in the agri-products world with sales and marketing management and some background exposure to managing operations as well This individual will appreciate working with a committed financial sponsor, and bring large company best practices to a dynamic and nimble, middle market enterprise. :: 297 :: <BR/> :: 298 :: <BR/> :: 299 :: Our client offers a competitive compensation package with base salary and bonus plus equity :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: Please include the position code 77474 in the Subject line of your response and choose the option to Upload and attach your resume in WORD format. :: 303 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: <BR/> :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: 	Apply to Job :: 308 :: Our focus is the Office of the CFO: the financial, operational and technology foundations that enable solid financial performance. We help manage critical transitions such as rapid growth, performance improvement and changes in ownership. :: 297 :: <BR/> :: 298 :: <BR/> :: 299 :: Job Description :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: The experienced Talent Acquisition Manager is responsible for recruiting qualified individuals to fill senior level positions within our growing financial and technology and healthcare practices. This is a very relationship oriented role and works closely with very senior level executives both internally and externally. The Talent Acquisition Manager is a point person for candidates, senior leadership, field HR, internal recruiting team as well as outside sources that will assist in sourcing of candidates. :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: Responsibilities :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: Identify, screen and recruit to fill large demand for top level financial, technology and healthcare executives in multiple markets. Meet aggressive hiring goals in a cost effective manner. :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: Manage and execute candidate sourcing strategies including web-based recruiting, networking in the market with leadership, ad development and placement, etc. :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: Manage the process and relationships between candidates, management and administrative professionals. :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: Participate in knowledge sharing with Human Resources and Tatum executives throughout the marketplace to expand best practices. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: Qualifications :: 321 :: <BR/> :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: To qualify for this outstanding executive recruiter opportunity, candidates must have: :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: • a Bachelor's degree, strongly preferred :: 326 :: <BR/> :: 327 :: • 5+ years of experience in a recruiting function, ideally from a professional services firm :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: • the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: • strong communication and team building skills :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: • excellent organizational skills :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: • knowledge of recruiting processes and components :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: • the ability to attract/retain high caliber professionals :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: • strong recruiting, and assessment skills :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: • proficient with database management and office computer software/systems :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: <BR/> :: 344 :: Tatum, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. :: 345 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 346 :: <BR/> :: It will include an attractive base salary and performance bonus. :: 287 :: 	<B> Description </B> :: 288 :: 	<BR/> :: 289 :: THE POSITION :: 290 :: <BR/> :: 291 :: <BR/> :: 292 :: This is an environment where people take ownership, and assume accountability. :: 293 :: <BR/> :: 294 :: <BR/> :: 295 :: The Head of US Sales will be clear and creative in questioning the go-to-market strategy, and challenging the status quo, and offering ideas supported by research and facts. :: 296 :: <BR/> :: 297 :: <BR/> :: 298 :: The Director will set clear and measurable objectives, and take responsibility for ensuring they are met. Reporting into the VP Marketing & Sales, the Head of US Sales is to build and monitor the Division’s infrastructure in order to evaluate the Brand’s expansion through various channels of distribution and to make or break end results as identified by the VP. This is accomplished through the development and management of a team of Field Key Account Managers and Market Development Scientists in the proper execution of the sales objectives. :: 299 :: <BR/> :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: The Director focuses on specific sales efforts aimed at expanding the availability of the Brand. :: 302 :: <BR/> :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: This is accomplished through leveraging substantial Agronomic industry experience in: :: 305 :: <BR/> :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: • Multi-channel selling :: 308 :: <BR/> :: 309 :: • Distributor relations :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: • Market savvy :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: • And people management/development :: 314 :: <BR/> :: 315 :: This scope of responsibility dictates that the Director be capable of initiating, developing, and maintaining superior relationships with all primary contacts (superiors, subordinates, colleagues, distributors, customers, etc.) :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: <BR/> :: 318 :: In order to be successful in this role, the Director must possess the ability to analyze, and prepare a budget. She/he must be able to project and forecast sales number based on industry and historical data. :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: <BR/> :: 321 :: Finally, with this broad range of requisites, the Director must be accomplished at managing these processes over a wide geographic territory. Although air travel is common, many trips will, necessarily, be made via vehicle. :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: <BR/> :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: <BR/> :: 326 :: Responsibilities: :: 327 :: <BR/> :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: • Brand Expansion through various channels of distribution :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: • Help build and develop the distribution infrastructure :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: • Hire, train, and develop a sales staff throughout the territory. :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: • Prepare and present annual Elemental plans for achievement. :: 336 :: <BR/> :: 337 :: • Develop and execute strategic and tactical sales plans, define methodologies, CRM information utilization and account objectives. :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: • Identify new markets in order to expand the brand, the distributors, and the employees who service the markets :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: • Coordination of Regional objectives. Strategic, focused interaction with the other Sales Leaders (F & A, Marketing) and the VP/President in order to efficiently and effectively execute the overall strategy for the company and the Region. :: 342 :: <BR/> :: 343 :: • Has participated in culture change with demonstrated strengths in communicating and leading change. :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: . :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge and attributes: :: 348 :: <BR/> :: 349 :: <BR/> :: 350 :: • Has been a sales leader in an organization where the creation of need for an innovative technology was important. An innovative, science based organization, preferably in the agronomic or plant science industries, is ideal. :: 351 :: <BR/> :: 352 :: • Strong, proven negotiating skills and capacity. :: 353 :: <BR/> :: 354 :: • Ideally, experience in leading sales in the crop production field. :: 355 :: <BR/> :: 356 :: • A strong entrepreneurial, field sales professional with 10 to 12 years of experience within an Agronomic environment. :: 357 :: <BR/> :: 358 :: • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Science, Marketing or related field. :: 359 :: <BR/> :: 360 :: • An autonomous, creative and innovative mind. :: 361 :: <BR/> :: 362 :: • Inspiring people in taking calculated risks while ensuring development of an exciting and motivating long term business vision :: 363 :: <BR/> :: 364 :: • Strong sense of urgency in moving key initiatives along speedily and effectively while paying attention to the details and accuracy of each and every execution :: 365 :: <BR/> :: 366 :: • Effective problem solving skills and critical thinking. May be faced with situations where he/she must recognize and take action to secure short and long term goals of company :: 367 :: <BR/> :: 368 :: • Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of complex issues and think through alternatives options quickly. Able to make timely decisions to address short and long term business issues and opportunities :: 369 :: <BR/> :: 370 :: • Superior presentation, writing and communication skills; thinks and openly communicates with all levels of the organization. :: 371 :: <BR/> :: 372 :: • Highly capable of translating business objectives into creative ideas. :: 373 :: <BR/> :: 374 :: • Exceptional leader with a passion to lead, coach and mentor. :: 375 :: <BR/> :: 376 :: <BR/> :: 377 :: <BR/> :: 378 :: Key Attributes: :: 379 :: <BR/> :: 380 :: <BR/> :: 381 :: • Self-Motivated :: 382 :: <BR/> :: 383 :: • Effective Communicator :: 384 :: <BR/> :: 385 :: • Championing Change :: 386 :: <BR/> :: 387 :: • Coaching and Developing Others :: 388 :: <BR/> :: 389 :: • Highly analytical :: 390 :: <BR/> :: 391 :: • Driven to deliver performance and numbers (financial literacy) :: 392 :: <BR/> :: 393 :: • Business Acumen :: 394 :: <BR/> :: 395 :: • Innovation :: 396 :: <BR/> :: 397 :: • In-depth Problem Solving and Analysis :: 398 :: <BR/> :: 399 :: • Integrity :: 400 :: <BR/> :: 401 :: • Driving for Results :: 402 :: <BR/> :: 403 :: • Team Leadership :: 404 :: <BR/> :: 405 :: • Respecting Diversity :: 406 :: <BR/> :: 407 :: Note: This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties that may be required to be performed by the Director now or in future. S/He will be required to follow any additional instructions deemed appropriate by the V.P. :: 408 :: <BR/> :: 409 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 410 :: <BR/> :: 411 :: <BR/> :: 412 :: <BR/> :: 413 :: Under new financial ownership they are embarking on an ambitious acquisition growth strategy which will play out over the next 3 to 5 years and ultimately lead to an exit sale or IPO. :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: We are looking for a Chief Financial Officer with a strategic mindset and strong manufacturing and cost accounting background, with a hands-on approach, willing to roll up their sleeves. You must be experienced in managing a decentralized finance organization and have developed and implemented a tuck-in acquisition strategy from concept through due diligence to post-acquisition integration. Additional assets will be implementation of ERP systems and management of the IT function, and experience in developing an offshore production capability either through joint venture or greenfield start-up of production operations in a low-cost region. You will ideally have worked in a private equity or LBO context. :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: You will be working with a substantial private equity sponsor with an excellent track record of building and growing successful platform growth portfolios. Your compensation will include competitive base salary and bonus with equity incentive. :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: Please include the position code 77505 in the Subject line of your Blair Group for Client :: 266 :: 	<B> Job Code: </B> :: 267 :: 	TBGSRSYSENG :: 268 :: 	<B> Location(s): </B> :: 269 :: 	Nebraska - Omaha :: 270 :: 	<B> Industries: </B> :: 271 :: 	<BR/> :: 272 :: 	1-28	<B> Functions: </B> :: 277 :: 	<BR/> :: 278 :: 	2-28	<B> Job Type: </B> :: 293 :: 	Fulltime :: 294 :: 	<B> Compensation: </B> :: 295 :: 	<BR/> :: 296 :: 	Base $115 to $125K+ and bonus of $25K to $35K+ :: 297 :: 	<B> Description </B> :: 298 :: 	<BR/> :: 299 :: Our client has evolved to become one of the world’s largest software companies with employees in more than 40 countries. The company provides security, storage and systems management solutions to help customers – from consumers and small businesses to the largest global organizations – secure and manage their information-driven world against more risks at more points, more completely and efficiently than any other company. :: 300 :: <BR/> :: 301 :: <BR/> :: 302 :: Sr System Engineer (Omaha, NE) - DataCenter/NBU :: 303 :: <BR/> :: 304 :: <BR/> :: 305 :: As Sr Account System Engineer you will participate in development of multi-year account plans for complex, strategic accounts. Able to act as SE team lead on projects impacting overall organization. Acts as customer's primary point of contact for all technical needs, and proactively develops technical relationships at all levels of the account, including senior executives and product management. :: 306 :: <BR/> :: 307 :: <BR/> :: 308 :: You will deliver product presentations and demonstrations internally and externally on all relevant Company solutions. Coordinates with Marketing and Sales to ensure that Company initiatives are timely and appropriate for current end user and/or market demand. The Account SE is responsible for partner satisfaction regarding technical aspects of initiatives. :: 309 :: <BR/> :: 310 :: <BR/> :: 311 :: Act as project lead to ensure that partner's specific product requirements are addressed in both current and future product development. Assists sales with building business cases for new opportunities. You will maintain technical knowledge of competitive solutions. :: 312 :: <BR/> :: 313 :: <BR/> :: 314 :: Manages all technical aspects of account in highly complex go-to-market model, leveraging both internal and partner resources. :: 315 :: <BR/> :: 316 :: <BR/> :: 317 :: Uses professional and technical concepts to contribute to development of company concepts and principles and to achieve objectives in creative and effective ways. Applies advanced principles, theories, and concepts. :: 318 :: <BR/> :: 319 :: <BR/> :: 320 :: Contributes to the development of innovative principles and ideas. :: 321 :: <BR/> :: 322 :: <BR/> :: 323 :: Uses knowledge, creativity, and company practices and priorities to obtain solutions to complex problems. :: 324 :: <BR/> :: 325 :: <BR/> :: 326 :: Works on extremely complex accounts where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables. :: 327 :: <BR/> :: 328 :: <BR/> :: 329 :: Exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. :: 330 :: <BR/> :: 331 :: <BR/> :: 332 :: <BR/> :: 333 :: Qualifications: :: 334 :: <BR/> :: 335 :: <BR/> :: 336 :: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent. :: 337 :: <BR/> :: 338 :: <BR/> :: 339 :: - 5-8 years experience in systems administration, pre-sales or related field. :: 340 :: <BR/> :: 341 :: <BR/> :: 342 :: - Previous vendor and or pre-sales Systems Engineering experience required. :: 343 :: <BR/> :: 344 :: <BR/> :: 345 :: - Expertise in security solutions and/or enterprise technology or software solutions. :: 346 :: <BR/> :: 347 :: <BR/> :: 348 :: - Have the ability to handle project management responsibilities for implementation of company related solutions assigned by the manager. :: 349 :: <BR/> :: 350 :: <BR/> :: 351 :: - Must possess presentation-ready knowledge of several Company or competitor solutions and possess expertise in products making up one or more solutions. :: 352 :: <BR/> :: 353 :: <BR/> :: 354 :: - Ability to present a professional appearance and demeanor. :: 355 :: <BR/> :: 356 :: <BR/> :: 357 :: - Ability to relate to a wide range of technical staff and managers in customer environments. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. :: 358 :: <BR/> :: 359 :: <BR/> :: 360 :: <B> Apply Here </B> :: 361 :: <BR/> :: 362 :: In order to view the contact details for this job, you must be a member of 6FigureJobs.
